meanings.definition: Pour (a liquid) from one container to another, typically without disturbing the sediment.
meanings.sent1: I will decant the juice into a smaller cup.
meanings.sent2: She likes to decant the water into a pitcher for easy pouring.
meanings.sent3: As a joke, he tried to decant the soda into a tiny bottle.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to decant the liquid from thin air.
meanings.sent5: The chef's graceful hands decant the sauce with precision.

meanings.definition: Transfer (wine or other liquid) from one container to another, typically in order to separate out sediment.
meanings.sent1: They will decant the wine carefully to avoid the sediment.
meanings.sent2: At the winery, they decant the aged wine into new bottles.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter managed to decant the wine without spilling.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to decant emotions from deep within her heart.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes decant colors onto the canvas.
